metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Handwritten letter from Tientsin. He notes how difficult the trip back to China was, as described in his previous letter. He confesses that he was anxious to leave the United States, but he hopes to return one day. From Yokohama, the S.S. Nanking left, after a delay of six hours because the Emperor of Japan was reviewing the Grand Fleet. They arrived in Shanghai on October 26th. Kwan met students including H.K. Kwong and K.P. Tsai. Since his return, Kwan has been setting up a contracting office and he hopes to have more news about the opportunities for work. He encloses a draft of $350 to pay for the loan of $300 plus interest and asks that the balance be sent to his brother. He sends regards to all in Andover.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
